decision_conditions: The Non-Material Amendment is approved and Condition 44 of planning permission ref: 22/02905/FUL is amended as follows:Prior to occupation, a scheme detailing the flood resistance measures must be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority with guidance from the Environment Agency. The scheme should include details on the passive and active flood barriers up to 8.31 metres above Ordnance Datum (mAOD) to protect: - The shared reception of the Hive and Honey Buildings - The car park basement access ramp,stairwell and lift lobbies The scheme shall be fully implemented and subsequently maintained, in accordance with the scheme's timing/phasing arrangements, or within any other period as may subsequently be agreed, in writing, by the local planning authority. Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future users.
description: Non-material amendment to permission 22/02905/FUL (Application under S73 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with condition 1 (Approved plans) of planning permission ref: 20/02495/FUL (Full planning application for the demolition of Surrey House, Multi Storey Car Park, Hippodrome and Bo Concept and the erection of 2(two) Office buildings [Use Class - E(g)(i)] Building A and Building B: Building A 9 storeys (22,144 (GEA) sqms) Building B 11 storeys (11,587 (GEA) sqms). The erection of a replacement multi storey car park of 354 spaces plus cycle parking (for use as a public car park at weekends) landscaping, public realm upgrades, servicing, pedestrian and vehicular access. This application is accompanied by an Environmental Statement) dated 02/12/2021. Variation to consist of revisions to the Car Park (Building C) ) Condition 44 (Wording of condition to be revised as below, to reflect both 'Active' & Passive flood barriers)
